pullRequest.title: CB-9487 - [ASRG] Eliminate resource leakage if deleting during ARM te…
pullRequest.bodyText:
…mplate deployment
This contains a fix for the following scenarios:

FreeIPA/SDX/RedBeams/DataHub deployment is launched
ARM template is sent in
Deletion request posted via template deployment

There are some edge cases which were not covered

template delete arrives when OS disks do not have valid id
template delete arrives when VM instance does not have valid id
deletion flow cleans up properly but in between the deletion end and the create flow interrupt, new resources get created

nodes.bodyText: Could you please extract these lines into a separate method?
Could you please extract these streams into a private method?
This could also make use of createCloudResource method
doOnError will not swallow the throwable, it just gives an opportunity to do something before the exception is thrown. That is, code after the await will not run in case of an error.
In case of an exception in one of the Completables the exception is not caught in doOnError, so it is not CloudbreakServiceException that will be thrown
Just a question: in what case will envName be the networkId?
There is findResources method. A findResource method with return type optional could be extracted.

The functionality of cancelling a deployment (by id or  by resourceGroup) and then getting the resources from it could be extracted to a separate class. This functionality is used at two other places in some variation.
The functionality of getting the instances and then the attached os disk resources is present at several places. It might make sense to extract it to a common method at a separate class.
The functionality of getting the deployment, cancelling it could be extracted.
